Description: A circular platter of medium coarse red siltware pottery, the whole is covered with a greenish-cream slip, worn and chipped away in parts. At the edge are three ridges running around the perimeter and in the centre of the underside is a very low ring-foot.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 11
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 11 has been scratched into the underside.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.91, fig.3, p.99, p.189, pl.31)
